incidents.name: High latency on Intercom Web Application

incident_updates.body: We have confirmed the issue has been fully resolved since 15:54 UTC.
The Intercom Web Application has recovered, we experienced high latency between 15:28 and 15:54 UTC. We are currently monitoring the situation.
We are still experiencing some latency, the team is investigating the issue and will report here on progress.

incidents.name: High latency on Intercom Web Application

incident_updates.body: Intercom Web Application is now fully operational, we have experienced high latency between 14:59 and 15:17 UTC with errors between 15:14 and 15:17 UTC.

incidents.name: Errors in the Inbox, Messenger and APIs

incident_updates.body: Between approximately 2023-07-03 0700 UTC and 2023-07-03 0830 UTC, customers would have experienced issues with loading Intercom; with degraded performance of Intercom; and features inside the Intercom product not working. This issue is now resolved, and all services are working as expected.

affected_components.name: Intercom message delivery - Chats and Posts

incidents.name: Unable to receive new conversations or comments from our Facebook integration

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved overnight. Any past conversations and comments will have been processed by now and available in Intercom.

We have identified an issue where customers using our Facebook integration are unable to receive new conversations or comments to existing conversations since ~20:00UTC. This is due to an apparent change in the Facebook API. We will continue to monitor this incident and their API for further updates.

incidents.name: Attachments not working in the messenger and inbox

incident_updates.body: Attachments are back to normal.
We've rolled a change back and attachments are now working again.
We're looking into attachments not working in the Intercom messenger and inbox.

incidents.name: Delayed ingestion of Articles content powering Fin

incident_updates.body: Between approximately 2023-06-22 1120 UTC and 2023-06-23 1040 UTC, customers who had triggered imports of their Help Center articles would have seen a delay in processsing longer than expected. This issue is now resolved, and all services are working as normal.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We are currently investigating a delay in Fin content ingestion from Articles. We have identified the issue and are working to fix it now.

A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

incidents.name: Stale data in Users Search

incident_updates.body: At 10.50pm UTC we successfully completed processing the user data backlog, user search data is no longer stale.
At 10.50pm UTC we successfully completed processing the user data backlog, user search data is no longer stale.
At 10.50pm UTC we successfully completed processing the user data backlog, user search data is no longer stale.
Affected AWS services have recovered, we are monitoring as we start to ingest user data again.

We continue monitoring the ongoing AWS outage: https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

At the moment we have not detected any additional impact on our services.
We are continuing to monitor possible degraded performance across our product as AWS expanded the list of affected services: https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

We are monitoring an AWS outage that is causing our Users Search data, in particular data will be stale when:

- Searching for users in the Teammate app
- In User Segments in the Teammate app
- In the Matching system (ex. sending outbound messages to users that no longer match filters)
- In the Contacts API

We will update as the situation evolves.

incidents.name: Latency and errors with Fin

incident_updates.body: Between 2023-06-07 0626 UTC and 2023-06-07 0745 UTC we monitored increased latency and error rates from our upstream AI provider OpenAI which would have affected Fin performance. This issue is now resolved and all services are working as expected.
Our upstream AI provider, OpenAI, is currently experiencing issues that are affecting the performance of Fin. We are monitoring the situation and will provide updates here.

We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

incidents.name: Partially degraded services across Intercom US

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor the situation. We are seeing recover across most of our services.
We have shipped a fix for this issue and are monitoring the situation as we work through a backlog of jobs.
We've identified the issue and are working on a fix
We are observing a significant delay in background jobs processing for our US data region across multiple services. We are currently investigating the root cause.

incidents.name: Multiple services in Intercom unavailable briefly

incident_updates.body: For a brief period of time our Articles, Messenger, API and Messenger Apps were partially degraded due to a bad code deploy. We have since reverted the change and are monitoring the situation.

incidents.name: Elevated Latency and Connectivity Issues with Intercom

incident_updates.body:
Between 2022-03-24 1249 UTC and 2022-03-24 1256 UTC, some customers would have experienced elevated latency issues and connectivity problems connecting to Intercom. This issue is now resolved, and all services are working as expected.

Customers using our EU and Australian Data Residency Regions would have been unaffected.

incidents.name: Increased error rates in the Intercom application

incident_updates.body: Customers would have experienced errors with loading the Intercom application, receiving HTTP 403 errors. This issue is now resolved and services are working as expected.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating increased error rates for the Intercom web app. Customers using our EU and AUS data residency regions are unaffected at this time.

incidents.name: Intercom Web App slow to respond

incident_updates.body:
Between 2023-03-22 1604 UTC and 2023-03-22 1625 UTC, customers would have experienced delays and errors in loading the Inbox. This issue has been resolved and all services are now working as expected.

Customers with workspaces in our EU and AUS data residency locations would have been unaffected.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating an issue with the Intercom App loading slowing for customers.

incidents.name: Issues with "Lost Connection" errors in the Inbox

incident_updates.body:
Between 2023-03-22 1456 UTC and 2023-03-22 1524 UTC, customers may have experienced errors in the Inbox regarding "Lost Connection", and the Messenger would have been delayed in sending real-time messages. This issue has been resolved, and all services are operating as normal. 

Edit: Customers may have experienced a brief short disruption again at 2023-03-22 1704 UTC. A hard refresh of your web browser should resolve any remaning issues.

Customers using our EU or Australian Data Hosting regions would have been unaffected at this time.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We've identified a cause for this error, and are working on resolving the problem.
We are currently investigating an issue where customers are receiving "Lost Connection"  error messages in the Inbox. Real-time messages such as "User is typing" are also affected at this time.

incidents.name: Help Center not working for customers

incident_updates.body:
Between 2023-03-20 1703 UTC and 2023-03-20 1715 UTC, customers would have experienced the Help Center product being unavailable and not loading. This issue is now resolved, and all services are working as expected.

Customers using workspaces hosted in Intercom's EU or AUS Data Regions would have been unaffected during this time.
We've shipped a fix here and are now monitoring for impact.
We are currently investigating reports of the Help Center product not loading correctly.

incidents.name: Issues logging into app.intercom.com

incident_updates.body:
Between 2023-03-20 1255 UTC and 2023-03-20 1335 UTC customers would have experienced an issue logging into https://app.intercom.com . This issue is now resolved, and all services are working as expected.

Customers who were already logged in were not affected during this time. Customer using our EU and AUS Regional hosting were also unaffected.

We have shipped a fix for this issue, and customers are able to log in now. We're monitoring now for full resolution.

Customers who are already logged in are unaffected at this time. Customer using our EU and AUS Regional hosting are also unaffected.

We are currently investigating issue where customers are getting a "Retry Later" error when trying to login into https://app.intercom.com. 

Customers who are already logged in are not affected at this time. Customer using our EU and AUS Regional hosting are also unaffected.

incidents.name: Intercom web application not available

incident_updates.body: Between 09:16 and 09:23 UTC the Intercom web application was down. We've taken action to resolve the problem.

incidents.name: Intercom web application not loading in Safari

incident_updates.body: Between 10:41 - 11:27 UTC the Intercom web application could not load on Safari. We rolled back a change and it is now working fine.
The Intercom web application is not booting for the Safari browser. We have identified the problem and are working on rolling back a change.

incidents.name: Brief Intercom web application disruption

incident_updates.body: Between 10:44 - 10:47 the Intercom web application, including the inbox, was slow or returning errors. We identified and rolled back the change that caused this.

incidents.name: Intercom down for all workspaces hosted in the US

incident_updates.body: Between 09:22 and 09:45 UTC, Intercom workspaces and services hosted in the USA region were down. We quickly identified and rolled back a deployment that caused the problem, but needed to also reboot a database cluster to restore service. We apologise for the disruption.

incidents.name: 1:1 outbound messages sent as email via the Inbox erroneously sent as In-App chat messages

incident_updates.body: Between approximately 2023-01-11 1450 UTC and 2023-01-12 1440 UTC, Intercom customers in US, EU and AUS data hosting regions would have experienced an issue when sending 1:1 outbound email messages via the Inbox. These messages would have been sent as In-App chat messages erroneously. This issue is now resolved and all services are working as expected.

incidents.name: Issues with Custom Bots not triggering for some customers

incident_updates.body: The issue has been resolved since 11:45 UTC, all Custom Bots actions should trigger as expected.
We are aware of instances where Custom Bots actions are not triggering correctly for customers, we are currently investigating the issue and will follow up with updates.

incidents.name: Errors sending messages via WhatsApp

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified the issue and are working to resolve it.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are aware of issues where customers using our WhatsApp integration are seeing their numbers listed as disconnected and being unable to send messages from our Inbox via WhatsApp.

incidents.name: New users entering into a Series would not have received messages

incident_updates.body: Between approx 0800 UTC on Sunday 4th December 2022 and 1000 UTC on Monday 5th December 2022, new users entering into a Series would not have received messages. Existing users would have been unaffected during this time. This issue is now resolved and all services are working as expected.
